Top-3 Scripts:
au_211136: # Manually start the module-loopback.
pactl load-module module-loopback

# Configure your system to load module-loopback on startup.
# This places load-module module-loopback at the end of
# the /etc/pulse/default.pa pulseaudio configuration file.
sudo sh -c ' echo "load-module module-loopback" >>  /etc/pulse/default.pa '

so_37688300: pactl load-module module-loopback latency_msec=1 source=alsa_input.pci-0000_00_1b.0.analog-stereo sink=bluez_sink.00_02_5B_00_FF_03

pactl load-module module-loopback latency_msec=1 source=bluez_source.00_02_5B_00_FF_03 sink=alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1b.0.analog-stereo

so_43319199: How to loop back the microphone entry directly to speakers on linux?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_43319199: arecord | aplay

arecord -l

arecord -Dhw:<card_num>,<device_num> -c <channel_number> –f <format> -r <sample_rate> | aplay -Dhw:<card_num>,<device_num>

Explanations about Options.-v:
Show PCM structure and setup. This option is accumulative. The VU meter is
 displayed when this is given twice or three times.
Explanations about Options.-d:
Interrupt after # seconds. A value of zero means infinity. The default is zero,
 so if this option is omitted then the record/playback process will run until it is
 killed. Either '-d' or '-s' option is available exclusively.
Explanations about Options.-c:
The number of channels. The default is one channel. Valid values are 1 through
 32.
Explanations about Options.-r:
Sampling rate in Hertz. The default rate is 8000 Hertz. If the value specified is
 less than 300, it is taken as the rate in kilohertz. Valid values are 2000 through
 192000 Hertz.
